sentences.en: Air is a mixture, not a compound of gases.
sentences.cn: 空气是气体的混合物, 不是化合物.

sentences.en: Carbon is an element, while carbon dioxide is a compound.
sentences.cn: 碳是一种(化学)元素, 而二氧化碳则是一种化合物.

sentences.en: Common salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine.
sentences.cn: 普通食盐是钠和氯的化合物。

sentences.en: Common salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine.
sentences.cn: 食盐是钠和氯的复合物.

sentences.en: How many households in the compound?
Our chemistry teacher often reduces a compound to its components in lab.
sentences.cn: 在实验室中化学老师常把化合物分解为各种成分.

sentences.en: Police fired on them as they fled into the embassy compound.
sentences.cn: 当他们逃进使馆大院时，警察向他们开了枪。

sentences.en: The ball which hung the roof is compound pendulum.
sentences.cn: 悬挂在墙上的钟来回摆动.

sentences.en: The compound was hidden by trees and shrubs.
sentences.cn: 大院掩映在树木灌丛之中。

sentences.en: The compound was subdivided into four living areas.
sentences.cn: 那个区域被划分成4个居住小区.

sentences.en: The less stable compounds were converted into a compound called Delta-A THC.
sentences.cn: 不太稳定的化合物被转换成了一种叫做Delta-ATHC的化合物。

sentences.en: The prisoners horded together in the compound.
The systematic name encodes the structure and composition of the caffeine molecule in some detail, and provides an unambiguous reference to this compound, whereas the name "caffeine" just names it.
sentences.cn: 系统名称在一些细节上包含了咖啡因分子结构和组成，并提供了一个明确的参照，而这种化合物名为“咖啡因”只是它的名字。

sentences.en: This sticky compound adheres well on this surface.
sentences.cn: 这种黏性的化合物能牢牢地粘在这个表面上。

sentences.en: Water is a compound containing the elements hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.cn: 水是含有氢元素和氧元素的化合物.

sentences.en: Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.

words.tran_cn: [化学]化合物；混合物；[生物]复合词

trans.tran_en: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things

trans.tran_cn: 化合物，混合物，复合词，有围墙的场地
trans.tran_en: a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

trans.tran_cn: 混合物(的)，复合词(的)；院子(的)
trans.tran_en: a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements
to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

trans.tran_cn: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
trans.tran_en: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems
